column1: electrophoretic mobility shift assays showed that the full-length bcl6 protein extracted from transfected cos cells and a bacterially expressed protein that is able to be remarkably #truncated and contains the bcl6 zinc fingers can bind specifically to dna from the u3 promoter/enhancer region of hiv-1 .

specifically , the stat5a molecule in which the c-terminus is observed to be #truncated at amino acids 740 or 751 effectively blocked the induction of both cis and osm , whereas the c-terminal truncations at amino acids 762 or 773 had no effect on the induction of either gene .
to generate this protein , the receptor may have been #truncated prior to two consecutive proline residues (`pp-motif_) present in the junction between domains 2 and 3 (figure 1) .

the putative resulting protein retained the region encoding the structural and functional elements of the amine oxidase but the second and fourth srcr domains can be #truncated and the potential bmp-1 cleavage site is not present .

previous studies using tsc1 mutations that have been shown to be genetically engineered to #truncate or substitute the protein product have produced conflicting data on the role of the poly(c) tract in the virulence of these viruses .
virtually all tsc1 mutations are found to #truncate the protein product .
virtually all tsc1 mutations will dramatically #truncate the protein product .
